conclusion: Understand how shadows are cast by objects on the ground when a light source is positioned above them.
Identify the objects and their shadows on the ground: cake, toilet paper roll, soccer ball, postcard; shadows labeled A, B, C, D.
Understand the relationship between the light source and the objects: light source positioned above objects, casting shadows on the ground.
When the light source moves to the right, the shadows will shift to the right as well.
Shadows will maintain the same relative size to the objects but change position due to the movement of the light source.
Determine new positions of shadows: shadow of cake, toilet paper roll, soccer ball, and postcard will move to the right.
Summarize the changes in shadow position: shadows will move to the right as the light source moves to the right.
Conclude the shadow movement based on the described changes.
The shadows will move to the right.
